greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 0 and for n > 0, a(n+1) is the odd part of k where k is the number of terms equal to a(n) among the first n terms.
comment: In other words, for n > 0, a(n+1) = A000265(o(n)) where o is the ordinal transform of the sequence.
link: Rémy Sigrist, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Rémy Sigrist, Logarithmic scatterplot of the first 2^16 terms
example: The first terms, alongside their ordinal transform, are:
program: (PARI) o=vector(38); v=0; for (n=1, 80, print1 (v", "); o[1+v]++; v=o[1+v]/2^valuation(o[1+v],2))
results.author: _Rémy Sigrist_, Nov 26 2019
